intro: Oxydectes brevispicata, commonly known as the short-spined dandelion, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and sandy soils, thriving in arid to semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive short, spiny pappus. Oxydectes brevispicata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
